revised_title: Investigation of 2:3 Butanediol and Acetylmethylcarbinol in Bacterial Metabolism
tldr: The authors studied the action of Bacillus lactis aerogenes on glucose and mannitol, focusing on the production of 2:3 butanediol and acetylmethylcarbinol. They found that the organism converts glucose into these compounds under anaerobic conditions. The authors also investigated the effect of free oxygen on their production and the action of B. lactis aerogenes on fructose.
